abstract: Merrill Lynch, an investment bank now owned by Bank of America, has started moving the first of thousands of employees to Midtown from Lower Manhattan, a departure that will ultimately leave floor after floor of empty office space at the World Financial Center.
lead_paragraph: Merrill Lynch, an investment bank now owned by Bank of America, has started moving the first of thousands of employees to Midtown from Lower Manhattan, a departure that will ultimately leave floor after floor of empty office space at the World Financial Center.

headline.main: As Finance Offices Empty, Developers Rethink Ground Zero
